item.title: PlayStation Icon Blue DualSense Controller Officially Revealed By Sony
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Sony is feeling blue — but in a good way — as the company has just revealed a new limited-edition DualSense controller. The Icon Blue Special Edition gives the peripheral a striking makeover, wrapping it in layered shades of blue, and it'll be available to preorder exclusively from Walmart for $85 when it goes on sale starting October 20.

The peripheral's colorway is inspired by the signature blue glow of the PS5 consoles when it's powered on, and according to Sony designer Leo Cardoso, the design is meant to capture the "feeling of anticipation and wonder" whenever you boot up the console. Other small touches include Katakana characters on the back and PlayStation shapes on the D-pad.

If you're looking for a different type of design, you can grab limited edition DualSense controllers inspired by two of the biggest PS5 exclusives of the year, as well as one of the company's beloved franchises. The God of War 20th Anniversary DualSense controller was recently revealed, and the design is directly inspired by Kratos' omega tattoo. Preorders for it are live ahead of its release on October 23, and it's priced at $85.

Sony still has stock of the $85 Death Stranding 2: On the Beach DualSense, which features a selection of black colors, subtle orange accents, and iconography inspired by one of the organizations present in the game, Drawbridge. The collector's edition for the game is also still in stock, while the standard edition has been discounted to $50.

The complete opposite of the Death Stranding 2 option is the Ghost of Yotei DualSense controller that launched alongside the game. Instead of sci-fi graphic design and dark colors, this one features elegant inkbrush art inspired by the game. The Ghost of Yotei PS5 controller is available in gold or black colors for $85.

A PlayStation 30th Anniversary book has also been announced, and it's currently scheduled to ship out in 2026. The 400-page hardcover book aims to be the definitive visual chronicle of the console, and inside you'll find unseen images from Sony's archive of research and development materials alongside insights from the people who designed the console.

As part of a PlayStation Studios publisher sale during Prime Big Deal Days, you can also get several other games at a discounted price, like Stellar Blade, Marvel's Spider-Man 2, and Ghost of Tsushima: Director's Cut.

item.title: Meta Quest 3S Amazon-Exclusive Bundle Is Only $249 For Big Deal Days
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon has two great Meta Quest 3S VR headset bundles in its Prime Big Deal Days sale. The 128GB base model is available for only $249, which matches the best-ever price for the best entry-level virtual reality headset around. As an added bonus, this is an Amazon-exclusive bundle with a bunch of free DLC for the popular online game Gorilla Tag. But if you love Batman, you may want to opt for the 256GB model, as it's on sale for a larger $71 discount and comes with the very cool Batman: Arkham Shadow VR game.

Amazon is also offering discounts on Meta's official Quest 3S accessories, including the Elite Strap, Elite Strap with Battery, Link Cable, Compact Carrying Case, and Carrying Case for headset with the Elite Strap. Take a look at all of the deals below before they expire on October 9 at 12 AM.

Meta Quest 3S 128GB - Gorilla Tag Bundle

$249 (was $300) | Exclusive to Amazon

This Amazon-exclusive bundle comes with $45 worth of in-game content for Gorilla Tag, a popular free-to-play online game starring gorillas without legs who love playing variations of tag. The freebie is called the Cardboard Hero Bundle, and it includes 1,000 shiny rocks as well as the Handiwork Helmet and Armor. If you've never subscribed to Meta Horizon+, you'll also get three free months of the Game Pass-esque service. In addition to granting access to a rotating library of games, subscribers get two free games each month, and you get to keep them even if you cancel your subscription.

The Quest 3S is a lightweight, standalone VR headset that comes with two wireless Touch Plus controllers. It's strong enough to play a wide range of impressive VR games directly on the headset's internal hardware, including showpiece titles like Batman: Arkham Shadow, Asgard's Wrath 2, and Assassin's Creed Nexus. For VR games like Half Life: Alyx that are beyond its built-in capabilities, the Quest 3S can be synced to wirelessly to a gaming PC or with a compatible link cable. You can also cloud stream games and use the headset as a wearable projector to watch movies and TV shows.

Meta's entry-level VR headset is a modified version of the more powerful and expensive Quest 3. Both models have 8GB RAM and use the Qualcomm Snapdragon XR2 chipset, which is a noticeable leap forward from the Quest 2. Outside of storage differences--the Quest 3 has 512GB--the internals are the same. Both versions come bundled with the wireless Touch Plus controllers, too. The Quest 3 has more advanced lenses, which results in a larger, clearer image. That said, the Quest 3S still looks great and can play the same games, and it even has slightly better battery life (2.5 hours).

With this deal, you're getting the Quest 3S 128GB model for half the price of the $499 Quest 3.

Meta Quest 3S 256GB - Batman: Arkham Shadow Bundle

$329 (was $400)

For $70 more you can double your storage to 256GB and get Batman: Arkham Shadow, a $50 game that's exclusive to the Quest 3 family. Arkham Shadow is an impressive action-adventure game that faithfully recreates the experience of being the Caped Crusader in VR.

New subscribers will also get a three-month free trial to Meta Horizon+. With Batman factored in, you're essentially getting seven free games over the next three months.

Meta Quest Elite Strap

$55 (was $70)

You'll also want to pick up a few accessories for the Quest 3S if you decide to purchase it. The default strap on it is admittedly not the best, but you can easily fix that with the Quest Elite Strap. This has a better texture and design, and while it's normally $70, it's on sale for $55.

Meta Quest Elite Strap with Battery

$104 (was $130)

The Elite Quest Strap with Battery is also a very good deal, as this equips the headset with some extra power. The battery is surprisingly lightweight for its design, and it sits at the rear of the headset to keep things balanced, adding around two more hours of playtime on a full charge. Normally $130, this is on sale for $104 during Prime Big Deal Days.

Meta Quest Link Cable

$64 (was $80)

You can also pick up the Meta Quest Link Cable and use it to connect your headset to your PC and its gaming library. While you can connect the Quest 3S to your PC wirelessly with the Air Link feature, the cable is nice to have as it make certain that there's less latency in your games.

Meta Quest 3S Carrying Cases

Compact: $28.29 (was $50) | For Elite Strap: $54.29 (was $70)

Both of the official travel cases for the Quest 3S are on sale for Prime Big Deal Days. The larger case, shown above, is discounted to $54.29 (was $70) and is made for the headset with the Elite Strap (with or without Battery). If you don't buy the Elite Strap, go with the Compact Carrying Case, which is on sale for a much larger discount.

The Compact Carrying Case has a much larger discount, as it's nearly 50% off. If you buy the Elite Strap, you'll want the standard case.
